items.text: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
Thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeness [of any thing] that [is] in heaven above, or that [is] in the earth beneath, or that [is] in the water under the earth:
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.

Thou shalt not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them: for I the LORD thy God [am] a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth [generation] of them that hate me; And shewing mercy unto thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain; for the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
Thou shalt not kill.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
Thou shalt not commit adultery.
Sinful Relationships
A man must not have sexual relations with his mother. (Leviticus 18:7)
Leviticus {18:7} The nakedness of thy father, or the nakedness of thy mother, shalt thou not uncover: she is thy mother; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
A man must not have sexual relations with his father's wife. (Leviticus 18:8)
Leviticus {18:8} The nakedness of thy father’s wife shalt thou not uncover: it is thy father’s nakedness.
A man must not have sexual relations with his sister. (Leviticus 18:9)
Leviticus {18:9} The nakedness of thy sister, the daughter of thy father, or daughter of thy mother, [whether she be] born at home, or born abroad, [even] their nakedness thou shalt not uncover.
A man must not have sexual relations with his half-sister. (Leviticus 18:11)
Leviticus {18:11} The nakedness of thy father’s wife’s daughter, begotten of thy father, she [is] thy sister, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
A man must not have sexual have relations with his son's daughter. (Leviticus 18:10)
Leviticus {18:10} The nakedness of thy son’s daughter, or of thy daughter’s daughter, [even] their nakedness thou shalt not uncover: for theirs [is] thine own nakedness.
A man must not have sexual have relations with his daughter's daughter. (Leviticus 18:10)
Leviticus {18:10} The nakedness of thy son’s daughter, or of thy daughter’s daughter, [even] their nakedness thou shalt not uncover: for theirs [is] thine own nakedness.
A man must not have sexual relations with his daughter. (Leviticus 18:10)
Leviticus {18:10} The nakedness of thy son’s daughter, or of thy daughter’s daughter, [even] their nakedness thou shalt not uncover: for theirs [is] thine own nakedness.
A man must not marry a woman and her daughter. (Leviticus 18:17)

Leviticus {18:17} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness; [for] they [are] her near kinswomen: it [is] wickedness.
A man must not marry a woman and her son's daughter. (Leviticus 18:17)

Leviticus {18:17} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness; [for] they [are] her near kinswomen: it [is] wickedness.
A man must not marry a woman and her daughter's daughter. (Leviticus 18:17)

Leviticus {18:17} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness; [for] they [are] her near kinswomen: it [is] wickedness.
A man must not have sexual relations with his father's sister. (Leviticus 18:12)
Leviticus {18:12} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father’s sister: she [is] thy father’s near kinswoman.
A man must not have sexual relations with his mother's sister. (Leviticus 18:13)
Leviticus {18:13} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother’s sister: for she [is] thy mother’s near kinswoman.
A man must not have sexual relations with his father's brother's wife. (Leviticus 18:14)
Leviticus {18:14} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father’s brother, thou shalt not approach to his wife: she [is] thine aunt.
A man must not have sexual relations with his daughter-in-law. (Leviticus 18:15)
Leviticus {18:15} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy daughter in law: she [is] thy son’s wife; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
A man must not have sexual relations with his brother's wife. (Leviticus 18:16)
Leviticus {18:16} Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy brother’s wife: it [is] thy brother’s nakedness.
A man must not have sexual relations with a wife and her sister. (Leviticus 18:18)
Leviticus {18:18} Neither shalt thou take a wife to her sister, to vex [her,] to uncover her nakedness, beside the other in her life [time.]
A man must not approach a menstruous woman for sexual relations or in any way. (Leviticus 18:19)
Leviticus {18:19} Also thou shalt not approach unto a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is put apart for her uncleanness.
Do not commit adultery. (Leviticus 18:20)
Leviticus {18:20} Moreover thou shalt not lie carnally with thy neighbour’s wife, to defile thyself with her.
A man or woman must not have sexual relations with an animal. (Leviticus 18:23)
Leviticus {18:23} Neither shalt thou lie with any beast to defile thyself therewith: neither shall any woman stand before a beast to lie down thereto: it [is] confusion.
A man must not have sexual relations with another man. (Leviticus 18:22)
Leviticus {18:22} Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it [is] abomination.
A man must not have sexual relations with a woman betrothed to another man. (Leviticus 19:20)

Leviticus {19:20} And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman, that [is] a bondmaid, betrothed to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
A man must not have sexual relations with a woman until he has lawfully acquired her in marriage. (Exodus 22:16-17)

Exodus {22:16}And if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife. {22:17}If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
#Do not allow your son or daughter to marry a Stranger. (Deuteronomy 7:3)
Leviticus {Deuteronomy 7:3} Neither shalt thou make marriages with them; thy daughter thou shalt not give unto his son, nor his daughter shalt thou take unto thy son.
Do not allow your daughter to play the harlot, allowing her to commit fornication. (Leviticus 19:29)
Leviticus {19:29} Do not prostitute thy daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to whoredom, and the land become full of wickedness.
A man must not have sexual relations with a woman who returns to him after having sexual relations with another man. (Deuteronomy 24:4)

Deuteronomy {24:4} Her former husband, which sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, after that she is defiled; for that [is] abomination before the LORD: and thou shalt not cause the land to sin, which the LORD thy God giveth thee [for] an inheritance.
A childless widow must not marry anybody outside of her husband's family. (Deuteronomy 25:5)

Deuteronomy {25:5} If brethren dwell together, and one of them die, and have no child, the wife of the dead shall not marry without unto a stranger: her husband’s brother shall go in unto her, and take her to him to wife, and perform the duty of an husband’s brother unto her.
A man must not divorce a woman he married after having raped her. (Deuteronomy 22:29)

Deuteronomy {22:29} Then the man that lay with her shall give unto the damsel’s father fifty [shekels] of silver, and she shall be his wife; because he hath humbled her, he may not put her away all his days.
A man must not divorce a woman he married after having slandered her. (Deuteronomy 22:19)

Deuteronomy {22:19} And they shall amerce him in an hundred [shekels] of silver, and give [them] unto the father of the damsel, because he hath brought up an evil name upon a virgin of Israel: and she shall be his wife; he may not put her away all his days.
A man must not allow himself to be castrated. (Deuteronomy 23:1)
Deuteronomy {23:1} He that is wounded in the stones, or hath his privy member cut off, shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD.
#A man must not divorce a woman, unless she committed premarital fornication. (Deuteronomy 24:1)

Deuteronomy {24:1} When a man hath taken a wife, and married her, and it come to pass that she find no favour in his eyes, because he hath found some uncleanness in her: then let him write her a bill of divorcement, and give [it] in her hand, and send her out of his house.
Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbour.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that [is] thy neighbour’s.
Do not set a stranger in the office of king. (Deuteronomy 17:15)

Deuteronomy {17:15} Thou shalt in any wise set [him] king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: [one] from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which [is] not thy brother.
